alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 19 at 9:49PM MDT until May 20 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING FRIDAY FROM LATE MORNING UNTIL MID EVENING FOR ALL AREAS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, WELL ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... .Elevated to locally critical conditions will continue through tonight in a few areas where gusty west-southwest winds coincide with poor humidity recoveries. Critical to locally extreme fire weather conditions will develop Friday when winds will be the strongest. Winds will taper off slowly after sunset Friday while humidity begins rising across the region. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 9 PM MDT FRIDAY... * AREA AND TIMING...Middle Rio Grande Valley and West Central Highlands Friday from 10 am MDT to 9 pm MDT Friday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West-southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...6 to 10 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley; West Central Highlands
